questions.question_text: A network administrator must create a redundant vHBA for the mission-critical virtual machines (VMs) installed on a Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect blade server. The VMs access multiple datastores using VSAN55 and VSAN95. The datastore on which the VMs are hosted must be accessible if any of the uplinks goes offline. Which action meets these requirements?

choices.C: Enable failover for the vHBA with VSAN55 and VSAN95 enabled.
choices.B: Assign VSAN55 and VSAN95 to vHBA1 and vHBA2.
choices.A: Attach VSAN55 to vHBA1 and VSAN95 to vHBA2.
choices.D: Configure load-balancing for vHBAs with VSAN55 and VSAN95 attached.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Cannot assign multiple VSANs to a vHBA. It is a single dropdown with one selection (unlike vNICs). Attaching one VSAN to one vHBA is the only option that is applicable here. Answer is A.

Selected Answer: B
Answer should be B "assign" as you need to create multiple vHBAs and assign the different VSANs to them.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


Server 1 fails to connect to the storage array over the Storage Area Network (SAN) of the Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switch. The requirements are to redesign the storage network and keep these considerations in mind:

• The traffic from each of the servers must be redundant and isolated.
• The design must tolerate hardware and software failures and upgrades of SAN fabric devices.

Which action must be taken to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agree, by creating two separate physical fabrics, failure in one of the fabrics won't disrupt communication on the second one.

choices.D: Place an additional Fibre Channel switch to create two physically independent storage fabrics.
choices.B: Create a SAN port channel that faces the storage device to sustain a link failure.
choices.C: Add an additional supervisor to the Fibre Channel switch to support nondisruptive upgrades.
choices.A: Enable NPV and F-Port-channel on ports that face Server 1 on the Fibre Channel switch to create redundant paths.

questions.question_text:
A network architect designs the iSCSI-based storage area network solution. The iSCSI datastore must be designed with high availability, minimal downtime, and no single point of failure. The requirement is to fail over I/O to alternate paths based on SCSI sense codes without reliance on network failures.

Which feature must be deployed to meet these requirements?

A network consultant reviews the requirements for the Storage Area Network (SAN) design. The proposed solution must offer a very efficient port usage and eliminate the need for a separate physical layer of switches and their associated ISLs. The design is not expected to require future expansion.

Which SAN topology must be used to meet these requirements?

A storage administrator receives reports of network delays when database software attempts to access the storage array. The virtual machines that host the database software are installed on different rack servers connected to the Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect domain. The existing SAN switches are connected to the Fabric Interconnects using two 8 Gb port-channel interfaces to connect the storage array. The storage administrator has decided to deploy iSCSI storage with four 10 Gbps interfaces connected to the Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnects.

Which deployment type resolves the problems with storage contention?

discussion.content:
How about vpc mode, A? Why can't this be the answer?
Virtual Port-Channel (vPC) mode on Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnects allows multiple physical links (in this case, the four 10 Gbps interfaces) to be aggregated and logically appear as a single connection to the storage appliance. This increases bandwidth and provides redundancy by allowing multiple physical paths to be used for iSCSI traffic without the complexity of Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) blocking certain links.

vPC enables load balancing and failover across multiple paths, addressing issues related to storage contention and network delays. The increased bandwidth and path redundancy will alleviate contention issues by ensuring there is enough capacity and reliability for storage traffic between the UCS servers and the iSCSI storage.

Selected Answer: B
Using dedicated appliance ports provides a direct high-bandwidth connections

Selected Answer: B
Apliance ports are for iSCSI arrays and NAS systems

choices.B: iSCSI storage with Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect using an appliance port
choices.D: iSCSI storage appliance on Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect in the storage end-host mode
choices.A: iSCSI storage with Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect in the virtual port-channel mode
choices.C: iSCSI storage appliance on Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect uplink trunk port
